page.name: Key Idea: Literacy is more than just reading.Â
page.content:
Literacy is not just reading. The components of literacy are reading, writing, language, speaking, and listening. Literacy includes being able to understand, analyze, and make use of text. That could be by reading signs, commenting on social media platforms, or learning how to fix a flat tire. To participate in society, create goals, and reach their full potential, people don't need to be able to write five-paragraph essays; however, they do need literacy skills.  Educators can help adults by reframing what literacy is and showcasing the reading, writing, talking, and listening skills learners already have. 

Remember, in today's world, digital literacy and oral communication are key critical components of literacy (Quinn, 2018 and Van Ingen & Matzat, 2018).
